metadata.title: CVE-2024-52531 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GNOME libsoup before 3.6.1 allows a buffer overflow in applications thatperform conversion to UTF-8 in soup_header_parse_param_list_strict. Inputreceived over the network cannot trigger this.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-52531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-soup-2.4 - 2.74.2-3ubuntu0.1
libsoup-gnome2.4-1 - 2.74.2-3ubuntu0.1
libsoup2.4-1 - 2.74.2-3ubuntu0.1
libsoup2.4-common - 2.74.2-3ubuntu0.1
libsoup2.4-tests - 2.74.2-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

gir1.2-soup-3.0 - 3.0.7-0ubuntu1+esm1
libsoup-3.0-0 - 3.0.7-0ubuntu1+esm1
libsoup-3.0-common - 3.0.7-0ubuntu1+esm1
libsoup-3.0-tests - 3.0.7-0ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsoup2.4 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.74.2-3ubuntu0.1').
libsoup3 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.7-0ubuntu1+esm1').
